claim: The Existence of God has been argued through pamphlets.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Moody stated about the Irish Rebellion of 1641 that were indeed massacres of Protestant settlers from England and Scotland by the Catholic Irish who resented being pushed off their land to make way for the Anglo-Scottish colonists , but that the numbers of dead were vastly exaggerated with some contemporary pamphlets claiming about 200 , 000 massacred while the real number appears to be about 4 , 000 killed .

claim: The Existence of God has been argued through pamphlets.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Other arguments for the existence of God have been proposed by St. Anselm , who formulated the first ontological argument ; Ibn Rushd  (  Averroes  )  and Thomas Aquinas , who presented their own versions of the cosmological argument  (  the kalam argument and the first way , respectively  )  ; Ren√© Descartes , who said that the existence of a benevolent God is logically necessary for the evidence of the senses to be meaningful ; and Immanuel Kant , who argued that the existence of God can be deduced from the existence of good .

claim: The Existence of God has been argued through pamphlets.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Plantinga 's version of the free-will defence argued that the coexistence of God and evil is not logically impossible , and that free will further explains the existence of evil without threatening the existence of God .

claim: The Existence of God has been argued through pamphlets.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Such a defence  (  not a `` theodicy '' proper  )  does not demonstrate the existence of God , or the probable existence of God , but attempts to prove that the existence of God and the presence of evil  (  or privatio boni  )  in the world are not logically contradictory .

claim: The Existence of God has been argued through pamphlets.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Unlike a defense , which tries to demonstrate that God 's existence is logically possible in the light of evil , a theodicy attempts to provide a framework wherein God 's existence is also plausible .
